node.title: England bat out final overs to salvage plucky draw in fourth Ashes test
node.description: Australia needed just one more wicket for victory at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
node.content: ["England's walking wounded have defied the Australia bowling attack to bat out a dramatic final day of the fourth Ashes test for a morale-boosting thriller of a draw at the Sydney Cricket Ground.", "Stuart Broad and James Anderson steered England to 270/9 at the close of play in the evening gloom, well short of the victory target of 388, but a huge turnaround, after heavy losses at Brisbane, Adelaide and Melbourne.", "Australia skipper Pat Cummins was unable to use pace in a tense final three overs, because of the fading light, and predecessor Steve Smith took his first test wicket in almost six years to dismiss Jack Leach for 26 with his leg spin.", "That left Australia needing one wicket in the last two overs, but Broad and Anderson stood firm to frustrate the home side, despite as many as eight fielders crowding around them.", "\"It's been a difficult tour, but we stood up and found a way to get a result out of this game,\" says England captain Joe Root.", "\"We wanted to put pride back into the badge. The way we went about it in this game, we did that.", "\"We know there's a long way to go. It would be nice to front up again next week and go one better.\"", "Opener Zak Crawley led off the rearguard with an assured 77 and Ben Stokes, who famously steered England to a dramatic victory at Headingley in the last Ashes series, chipped in with 60 runs, despite being clearly hampered by a side injury.", "Although not reaching the heights he can as a batsman, Root played his part with 24 runs in a fourth-wicket partnership of 60 with Stokes, after rain stopped play for an hour after lunch.", "Playing with a thumb injury, first-innings centurion Jonny Bairstow contributed 41, before becoming Scott Boland's 14th victim in the paceman's second test.", "Also nursing a finger injury that will rule him out of the fifth test, Jos Buttler scored 11 runs from 38 balls, before becoming one of two batsmen to depart in three deliveries from Cummins with the new ball.", "\"There was clearly a bit of pain relief required,\" Root adds.\u00a0\"It's not just physical element, but the psychology of knowing that you're going into a pressure situation not 100%, to then be able to perform at the level some of the guys did was phenomenal really.\"", "For the second year in a row, Australia failed to dismiss their opponents on the final day of the SCG test to secure victory, after India batted out a draw last year.", "\"It was a great game of test cricket,\" says Cummins. \"We came close.", "\"We'd have loved to go 4-0, but it was a good match.", "\"When you are that far ahead in a game, of course you want to win it. We got close, but just not close enough.\"", "Australia had dominated most of the match, declaring twice and turning every apparent setback they faced into an advantage.\n", "Man of the Match Usman Khawaja came into the side for his first test in more than two years and scored centuries in both innings, as a middle-order replacement for Travis Head, who had tested positive for COVID-19.", "Frontline quick Josh Hazlewood was unavailable for a third straight match, because of injury, but that only allowed Boland to continue an extraordinary start to an unlikely test career.", "The 32-year-old took 6/7 on debut, as England were skittled for 68 in their second innings in Melbourne.", "He took 4/36 in the first innings and 3/30 in the second in Sydney, finishing with an unprecedented average of 8.64 among bowlers who have 10 or more deliveries in tests.", "Boland took two wickets in four maidens in an extraordinary spell at the start of day three, when England lost three batsmen without scoring a run for 53 deliveries.", "Despite gritty resistance from Bairstow and Stokes, Australia were able to dismiss England for 294 in reply to their first inning 416/8 declared.", "Khawaja's second century and a 179-run fifth-wicket partnership with Cameron Green on day four put the hosts in a position for a second declaration on 265/6.", "Cummins defends his decision to leave the second declaration so late, blaming - in part - the weather forecast.", "\"I thought the wicket was still not playing too many tricks,\" he says. \"I thought, if they batted really well, 350 was achievable out there.\"\u00a0", "Reuters"]
